title: Treos 2015 Albariño (Willamette Valley)
description: Albariño is not the first grape that springs to mind when thoughts turn to Willamette Valley wines, but what a pleasant discovery this is. A spicy, refreshing, New World take on this Spanish variety, here are layers of citrus rind—lemon, lime and grapefruit—that broaden out into like flavors. Keep tasting and satsuma orange and a bit of pineapple come into play. An absolute delight.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Rich and dense, this concentrated wine has a fine, smooth texture that is ripe with red-berry fruits. The freshness of the vintage comes through in the acidity and crisp, taut texture. The wine will be ready to drink from 2020, the 800th anniversary of the oldest-known traces of this vineyard.
designation: Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru

title: Clos Venturi 2013 Chiesa Nera White (Vin de France)
description: An unusual blend of old varieties such as Biancu Gentile and Genovese, this is a beautiful wine. It has exotic perfumed fruits, ripe tangy acidity and a full, rich character. Pepper and herbs add complexity at the end. Drink now.

title: Cullen 2014 Ephraim Clarke Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: Matured in 70% new French oak for six months, this is quite different from most Margaret River versions of this blend. It's more like a white Graves, with a silky mouthfeel and ripe, restrained fruit notes of fig and melon that linger on the finish.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Field Blend Zinfandel Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)
description: Packed with flavor and hefty in texture, this wine is almost chewy. It shows a delicious ripe berry character and feels velvety on the tongue as its ample, fine-grained tannins mingle with full body and pure flavor concentration.

title: DeTierra Vineyards 2013 Mesa Del Sol Syrah (Arroyo Seco)
description: Squeezed boysenberry, smoked beef, thyme, lavender and even rosemary show on the nose of this fresh and smoky bottling from a lesser-known appellation. The savory qualities invade the palate, where dried herbs, soy and smoked meat hang on a backbone of dense berry fruit and slightly chunky tannins, finishing with crushed mint.

title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Clos de Vougeot
description: Every producer seems to own, or have access to, a small part of Clos de Vougeot even if quantities produced are tiny. This wine is still firm, packed with tannins although providing hints of the delicious red fruits to come. It is a structured while also generous wine, just needing time. Drink from 2022.

title: Domaine de Suremain 2014 Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: This four-acre, east-facing slope has produced a rich, ripely maturing wine, with rounded red fruits layered with acidity. It's a generous wine, full in the mouth. The aftertaste continues the juicy, fruity theme, firmly sustained by the tannins.

title: Cedarville 2013 Naylor Vineyard Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: Good depth of flavor and a sense of layering makes this wine especially enjoyable. A big aroma pulls in wood smoke, black pepper, black cherry, generous fruit flavors, dark chocolate and smoky accents.

title: Château de Santenay 2014 Les Pruliers Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: This structured wine is firm at this early stage, with tannins and a touch of bitter-chocolate extraction that needs to diminish before the black fruits get their chance. Keep this dark, solid wine until 2022.

title: Albert Morot 2014 Les Toussaints Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This is a ripe wine. Red plum and berry fruits are given weight and richness by the solid tannins, smoky flavors and the dryness at the heart of the wine. Give this structured wine time to develop and drink from 2021.

title: Alex Gambal 2014 Les Enseignères  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
description: Packed with both wood and ripe fruit, this rich wine is full of juicy citrus and spice flavors that are lifted by the steely acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017.

title: Argyle 2012 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: This is three-quarters Pinot Noir, 15% Pinot Meunier and 10% Chardonnay. It's a thoroughly captivating rosé, with Champagne-like finesse. Concentrated flavors deftly mingle cherry, green citrus and herb, with a lovely mineral base.

title: Azelia 2012 Margheria  (Barolo)
description: Scorched earth, grilled herb, toast and ripe berry aromas lift out of the glass. On the dense, full-bodied palate, notes of cinnamon, clove and licorice add depth the black cherry core. Firm, velvety tannins provide the framework.

title: Durigutti 2010 Familia Red (Mendoza)
description: Ripe, toasty, smoky aromas of blackberry, cassis, licorice and prune are gritty. This is big, tannic and blocky, with tartaric scrape. Flavors of blackberry, cassis, raw oak, licorice and spice finish with notes of toast, chocolate and baking spices. Drink this full-bodied, jammy blend of Malbec and four other red grapes through 2020.

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2015 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Fresh yellow peaches seem to be layered in honey and pollen throughout this lusciously sweet, lip-smacking Riesling. The midpalate bristles with acidity, but it's harmoniously balanced, bursting of fresh apples and lemons. The finish is elegant and long, laced in soft tea tannins.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spätlese

title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Coucherias Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Packed with red fruits, this wine has great potential, with attractive wild-strawberry fruits that are fresh and perfumed. Behind this fruitiness, the wine is tight and structured. It will be round, rich and ready to drink from 2019.

title: Fiuza 2013 Ikon Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: This is a ripe powerful wine. It has layers of wood aging adding spice to the rich black-plum fruit. Smoky, rich and concentrated, it is an impressive wine that is going to need some long-term aging. Drink from 2019.

title: MacRostie 2013 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Mighty Klopp fruit is hard to get, and the tiny production of this wine reflects the coveted nature of these grapes. Justice is done; this beauty shows funky, soft and floral characteristics that persist on the palate, along a streak of black cherry and chocolate.

title: MacRostie 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dried herb, forest, berry and black peppery cola combine on the nose and palate to delirious effect, making way for a velvety texture of medium-sized body and weight. Sourced from several vineyards, including some estate, this wine satisfies on every level.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Clous  (Meursault)
description: At this stage, this wine still shows considerable wood flavors. As it develops, its rich pear and peach fruit will come more to the fore along with the crisp edge of acidity and citrus. The texture, with its mineral edge, will allow this single-parcel wine to develop well. Drink from 2018.

title: St. Innocent 2014 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: There's a lushness to this warmly fruity vineyard selection, that wraps the mixed red-berry fruit in a blanket of milk chocolate. Hints of mint and fresh herb strike a bright note as well, and the finish suggests that another year or two of bottle age will bring out still more complexity. Drink 2018 through 2028.

title: Rizzi 2013 Pajorè  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark berry, leather, menthol, underbrush and a note of baking spice mingle together in the glass. On the palate, fresh acidity and lithe tannins balance ripe Morello cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and dark spice flavors. Drink 2018–2023.

title: Paolo Scavino 2012 Carobric  (Barolo)
description: Intensely fragrant, this opens with scents of violet, rose, perfumed berry and a subtle whiff of menthol. The elegant, structured palate delivers tart cherry, white pepper, clove and a hint of coffee alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Rui Reguinga 2013 Quinta de Vale Veados Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: A firm wine that has both fine tannins and rich fruit, it shows its wood aging, with spice and sweet toast flavors. At the same time, the structure is rich, both in tannins and in blackberries. This serious wine, from vines planted on a former royal hunting park, is worth aging another year, so drink from 2017.

title: Pelassa 2010 Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Red rose, wild berry and Alpine herb aromas take shape in the glass. The delicious palate offers succulent black cherry, cinnamon and clove. It's balanced, with tight, velvety tannins and bright acidity. A licorice note closes the juicy finish. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Paul O'Brien 2013 Susan's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: A reserve selection from the vineyard, located near the Elkton gap, this subtle wine is tempered with details of herb and baking spices. It's pretty and proportionate, with crushed raspberry, black cherry and a hint of forest floor. It shows the sort of compact complexity that suggests that with more bottle age it will continue to evolve.

title: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Zingaretti Vineyard Malbec (Valle de Uco)
description: Toasty cherry, blackberry and cassis aromas are lightly charred. Jammy but thorough and lush, this tastes of raisin, stewed berry fruits and baking spices. A dry, peppery, oaky finish is well integrated and echoes with a note of medicinal black fruit. Drink through 2021.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2014 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Firm with tannins, this wine also is full of red-berry fruits and attractive acidity. With the tight structure, the wine is going to develop slowly, its richness coming out gradually. Drink from 2019.

title: Niner 2014 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Compelling scents kick off this wine, from black cherry and black-plum skins to vanilla-ginger cookies and pepper dust. There is an imposing structure to the palate, which holds up the black plum, dark strawberry, thyme-led herbal character and peppery spice.
